```{r}
library(maps) # For map data
library(tidyverse)
```

Create simple US map with some points
```{r}
# data from {maps}
usa <- map_data("usa")

# create usa map
usa_map <- ggplot() + 
  geom_polygon(data = usa, aes(x = long, y = lat), fill = "gray") + # , group = group
  coord_fixed(1.3)

# add points to map
labs <- data.frame(
  long = c(-122.064873, -122.306417),
  lat = c(36.951968, 47.644855),
  names = c("SWFSC-FED", "NWFSC"),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
  )  

usa_map + 
  geom_point(data = labs, aes(x = long, y = lat), color = "black", size = 5) +
  geom_point(data = labs, aes(x = long, y = lat), color = "yellow", size = 4)


```

States
```{r}
states <- map_data("state")
dim(states)

# plot all states
ggplot(data = states) + 
  geom_polygon(aes(x = long, y = lat, fill = region, group = group), color = "white") + 
  coord_fixed(1.3) +
  guides(fill=FALSE)  # do this to leave off the color legend
```

Subset west coast
```{r}
west_coast <- states |> 
  filter(region %in% c("california", "oregon", "washington"))


ggplot(data = west_coast) + 
  geom_polygon(aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group), fill = "palegreen", color = "black") + 
  coord_fixed(1.3)
```

Just CA
```{r}
ca_df <- subset(states, region == "california")
counties <- map_data("county")
ca_county <- counties |> 
  filter(region == "california")


ca_base <- ggplot(data = ca_df, mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group)) + 
  coord_fixed(1.3) + 
  geom_polygon(color = "black", fill = "gray") +
  geom_polygon(data = ca_county, fill = NA, color = "white") +
  geom_polygon(color = "black", fill = NA) + # get the state border back on top
  theme_void()


```
